conclusion: The problem involves calculating the work done by frictional force on an object moving on a conveyor belt.
The image shows a conveyor belt with two wheels labeled M and N, moving at 6 m/s, with an object placed above wheel M.
Calculate the normal force on the object: N = m * g = 3 kg * 10 m/s^2 = 30 N.
Calculate the force of friction: F_f = Î¼ * N = 0.3 * 30 N = 9 N.
Determine the work done by friction: W = F * d = 9 N * 10 m.
Calculate the work done: W = 90 J.
The work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object is 90 J.
